intro: Argemone leiocarpa, commonly known as the Mexican buttercup, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of the southwestern United States. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its showy yellow flowers with red centers. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain oily seeds, which are sometimes used in traditional medicine. It thrives in dry, disturbed soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens, though it can be invasive in some regions.
